parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The version control mode. If not provided, defaults to write mode if the user is allowed to see that. Can also be set in the header.

parameters.name: X-Ansys-VC-Mode
parameters.description: The version control mode. If not provided, defaults to write mode if the user is allowed to see that. Can also be set in the query string.

Example 1.description: This example demonstrates how to export data for attributes 'Shape factor' and 'Young's modulus' from the 'MaterialUniverse' records 'Alumino Silicate - 1720' and '250 Maraging Steel' in database 'MI Training'.

Example 2.summary: Data Export with record history IDs
Example 2.description: This example demonstrates how to export data for attributes 'Shape factor' and 'Young's modulus' from the 'MaterialUniverse' records 'Alumino Silicate - 1720' and '250 Maraging Steel' in database 'MI Training' by specifying the record history IDs.

Example 3.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Metals Pedigree' record 'Batch 921' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Tensile Test Data'.

Example 4.summary: Linked Records Export - no target specified
Example 4.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Metals Pedigree' record 'Batch 921' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Tensile Test Data'. This export does not specify the target of the link group (database, table), so the one defined in the schema will be used as default instead.

Example 5.summary: Linked Records Export - In Reversed Direction
Example 5.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Tensile Test Data' record 'MTS-615721' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Metals Pedigree', which is the reverse of link group 'Tensile Test Data'.

Example 6.summary: Linked Records Export - include indirect links
Example 6.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Metals Pedigree' record 'Batch 921' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Tensile Test Data' including indirectly linked records. By default the behavior of indirect links is inherited from the link definition.

Example 7.summary: Linked Records Export - exclude indirect links
Example 7.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Tensile Statistical Data' record '300F' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Design Data' excluding indirectly linked records. By default the behavior of indirect links is inherited from the link definition.

Example 8.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Composite Pedigree' record 'LBU14' in database 'MI Training', following the dynamic record link group 'Tensile Test Data'.

Example 9.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Metals Pedigree' record 'Batch 921' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Tensile Test Data'. It includes the linked records' full name and color, and data for attributes 'Young's Modulus (11-axis)' and 'Test Temperature'.

Example 10.description: This example demonstrates how to export linked records from the 'Metals Pedigree' record 'Batch 921' in database 'MI Training', following the record link group 'Tensile Test Data'. It includes the linked records' full name and color, and data for attributes 'Young's Modulus (11-axis)' with 'Mean' rollup and 'Test Temperature' with 'Max' rollup.

Example 11.description: This example demonstrates how to export tabular data from the 'Material Universe' record 'Barium silicate' in database 'MI Training', from the tabular attribute 'Restricted substances associated with this material'.It includes the local column 'Amount', the linked attribute 'Chemical name' (in the 'Restricted substances' table), and the linked column 'Effective date' from the 'Legislations restricting its use' tabular attribute

Example 12.summary: Tabular Data Export - no target specified
Example 12.description: This example demonstrates how to export tabular data from the 'Material Universe' record 'Barium silicate' in database 'MI Training', from the tabular attribute 'Restricted substances associated with this material'.It includes the local column 'Amount', the linked attribute 'Chemical name' (in the 'Restricted substances' table), and the linked column 'Effective date' from the 'Legislations restricting its use' tabular attribute. This export does not specify the tabular targets (database, table and attribute), so the ones defined in the schema will be used as defaults instead.

Example 13.description: This example demonstrates how to export tabular data from the 'Material Universe' record 'Barium silicate' in database 'MI Training', from the tabular attribute 'Restricted substances associated with this material'.Only rows where there is a linked record in the 'All Substances' subset will be returned

Example 14.summary: Tabular Data With Summary Row and Tabular Rollup
Example 14.description: This example demonstrates how to export tabular data from the 'Material Universe' record 'Barium silicate' in database 'MI Training', from the tabular attribute 'Restricted substances associated with this material'.It will include a tabular rollup of the maximum of the 'SVHC under REACH', and a summary row of the linked records and their chemical names

post.summary: Export data from the integration schema.

get.summary: Returns the URL that the given helpKey maps to.

parameters.name: help-key
parameters.description: The help key.

get.summary: Redirects client to the URL that the given helpKey maps to.

parameters.name: help-key
parameters.description: The help key.

get.summary: Lists the available integration schemas.

post.summary: Add an integration schema. Will fail if the schema is not valid, or if the user is not both a global administrator and an administrator for the schema.

400.description: Bad request. Returns validation errors information

403.description: Forbidden. User is not a global administrator or an administrator for the schema

get.summary: Returns the status of a given integration schema.
Returns the status of all available integration schemas.

put.summary:
Updates an integration schema.
Will fail if the schema does not exist, is not valid, or if the user is not both a global administrator and an administrator for the schema.

400.description: Bad request. Returns validation errors information

403.description: Forbidden. User is not a global administrator or an administrator for the schema

404.description: Not Found. Schema does not exist

delete.summary: Delete an integration schema. Will fail if the schema does not exist, or if the user is not both a global administrator and an administrator for the schema.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Schema to be deleted

get.summary:
Returns the full object representing the integration schema.
Names and identities of source items will be populated if they can be found in the databases currently loaded in MI, otherwise just the GUIDs will be returned.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The schema name.

parameters.name: includeImplicitAttributes
parameters.description: Whether to add in the schema attributes derived from certain record properties (e.g. Record Name) that are implicitly in all integration schemas. False by default.

get.summary: Returns a list of the attributes defined in the integration schema.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The schema name.

parameters.name: includeImplicitAttributes
parameters.description: Whether to add in the schema attributes derived from certain record properties (e.g. Record Name) that are implicitly in all integration schemas. False by default.

get.summary:
Returns a list of the schema source mapping from the given table. Will fail if the database is not loaded in MI.
Names and identities of source items will be populated.

get.summary: Get job by ID.

post.summary: Move a job to the top of the queue (actually sets the scheduled execution date to now, could be done with patch method).

Uploads an ephemeral file and returns an ID which can subsequently be used to refer to that file in a job creation request. Ephemeral files have a short lifespan
and should be used to provide file data to jobs only. They should not be used as file storage.

get.summary: Get a job's output filenames.
Retrieve a job output file.
Get the current user.
Get the processing configuration.

Either checks out a user license for the requesting user, or returns an error response if no such license is available.
This method is a no-op because it relies on license check to happen within Granta.Server.Api.Auth.UserContextFilter

post.summary:
Checks out server wide licenses and returns a bool for each provided app name indicating if
the relevant license(s) required have been checked out.

Example 1.description: This example demonstrates a request to the endpoint to check if the relevant licenses required to use BoM Analyzer are checked out. This endpoint currently does not support all application names and unsupported names will not be returned in the response.

Example 2.summary: License request with multiple application names
Example 2.description: This example demonstrates a request to the endpoint to check if the relevant licenses for each application name have been checked out. This endpoint currently does not support all application names and unsupported names will not be returned in the response.

post.summary: Update the status of an existing list to "awaiting approval".
Update the status of an existing list to not be "awaiting approval".

Update the status of an existing list to "published". The list must be awaiting approval, and not already published.
The "awaiting approval" flag will be reset to false.

Update the status of an existing list to "unpublished". The list must be published, and awaiting approval.
The "awaiting approval" flag will be reset to false.
Creates a private copy of a list that can be revised.
Creates a copy of the list and its items
Subscribes the calling user to the specified list.
Unsubscribes the calling user from the specified list.

post.summary: Sets permissions for the specified list. Returns a collection of the created/updated permissions.

put.summary: Sets the permission flags of the permission associating the specified list with the specified user.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The version control mode. If not provided, defaults to write mode if the user is allowed to see that. Can also be set in the header.

parameters.name: X-Ansys-VC-Mode
parameters.description: The version control mode. If not provided, defaults to write mode if the user is allowed to see that. Can also be set in the query string.

404.description: Database, table or record history not found

post.summary: Create a new record history.

Example 1.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new record history at the root of the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database.

Example 2.summary: Record History with Tree Name and Parent
Example 2.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new record history with a specified tree name under the 'Alumino Silicate' folder (guid = 5a842e54-e143-45f5-aec8-18fb84f4fe03) in the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated.

Example 3.summary: Record History for a 'folder' with specified guid
Example 3.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new 'folder' with no 'tree name' (so is set to the 'full name') and a specified guid under the 'Glasses' folder (guid = f92315e2-f836-4c2e-aba1-6d8a1a49e8a3) in the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated.

Example 4.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new 'folder' with a specified color under the 'Glasses' folder (guid = f92315e2-f836-4c2e-aba1-6d8a1a49e8a3) in the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated.

Example 5.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new 'generic' under the 'Glasses' folder (guid = f92315e2-f836-4c2e-aba1-6d8a1a49e8a3) in the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated.

post.summary: Make a copy of a record history.

Example 1.summary: Copy Record History - no name change - add new record to the new parent's subsets
Example 1.description: This example demonstrates how to copy an existing record history, by default the 'name' and 'short name' are not changed. The the new record history is created under the 'Glasses' folder (guid = f92315e2-f836-4c2e-aba1-6d8a1a49e8a3) of the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database.

Example 2.summary: Copy Record History - with name change - add new record to the original record's subsets
Example 2.description: This example demonstrates how to copy an existing record history and change the 'short name' of the newly created record version. The the new record history is created under the 'Glasses' folder (guid = f92315e2-f836-4c2e-aba1-6d8a1a49e8a3) of the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database.

Example 3.summary: Copy Record History to be directly under the Table - don't copy any subsets.
Example 3.description: In order to copy an existing record history to be at the top of the 'record tree' i.e directly under the 'Table' then do not specify the 'NewParent' property.

post.summary: Create a new attribute.

Example 1.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new date-time attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database.

Example 2.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new date-time attribute with a specified guid for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. The same thing can be done for all attribute types.

Example 3.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new date-time attribute that should not be shown in search UIs. It will still be included in text searches. It will be created in the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) from the MI_Training database. The same thing can be done for all attribute types.

Example 4.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new discrete attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000), using the 'Material type' discrete type, from the MI_Training database.

Example 5.description: This example demonstrates how to create a multi-valued discrete attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000), using the 'Material type' discrete type, from the MI_Training database. You can change the attribute back to a single-valued one as long as there is no multi-valued data already existing.

Example 14.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new point attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) to represent a single-valued property with the unit of 'kg' from the MI_Training database.

Example 15.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new point attribute for the 'MaterialUniverse' table (guid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000) to represent a multi-valued property with the unit of 'kg' from the MI_Training database. You can later change the attribute back to single-valued as long as there is no multi-valued data already existing.

Example 2.description: This example demonstrates how to update the 'Guid' property of the 'Melting point' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 0000000d-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000).

Example 3.description: This example demonstrates how to update the 'HelpPath' property of the 'Metals' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 0000000b-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000).

Example 4.description: This example demonstrates how to update the default threshold type of the 'Metals' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 0000000b-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000).

Example 5.description: This example demonstrates how to update an attribute so that it should not be shown in search UIs. It will still be included in text searches. The example is for the 'Metals' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 0000000b-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000).

Example 6.description: This example demonstrates how to update the 'Metals' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 0000000b-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000) and make it multi-valued. You can similarly turn a multi-valued discrete attribute into a single-valued as long as there is no multi-valued data already existing.

Example 7.description: This example demonstrates how to update the 'Grain size' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 000000aa-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000) and make it unique. This will work as long as there is no pre-existing data which violates the constraint.

Example 8.description: This example demonstrates how to update the 'Shape factor' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 00000144-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000) and make it multi-valued. Note that this won't work if the attribute is used in a dynamic link group index, expressions, X-Y charts or as linked attribute tabular column.You can similarly turn a multi-valued point attribute into a single-valued as long as there is no multi-valued data already existing.

Example 9.description: This example demonstrates how to update the 'Shape factor' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 00000144-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000) and make it multi-valued with 'Temperature' as a parameter. Note that this won't work if the attribute is used in a dynamic link group index, expressions, X-Y charts or as linked attribute tabular column.You can similarly turn a multi-valued point attribute into a single-valued as long as there is no multi-valued data already existing.

Example 10.description: This example demonstrates how to update the unit of the 'Reserves' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 00000088-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000). We will change the unit from 'tonnes' to 'kg'

Example 11.description: This example demonstrates that it is possible to change multiple attribute properties at once by updating the name of the 'Grain size' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 000000aa-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000) and also making it unique. This will work as long as there is no pre-existing data which violates the constraint.

Example 12.summary: Turn an attribute into a meta-attribute
Example 12.description: This example demonstrates how to turn an existing attribute into a meta-attribute of another attribute. We make the short text 'Color' attribute from the 'MaterialUniverse' table from the MI_Training database (tableGuid = 0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000; attributeGuid = 00000169-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000) become a meta-attribute of 'ISO name' short text attribute (guid = 000002cf-0001-4fff-8fff-dd92ffff0000).Note that if an attribute already had meta-attribute, it cannot be made a meta-attribute. Also, you cannot add a meta-attribute to another meta-attribute.

Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated. This will link from 'MaterialUniverse' table to a table in different database. Since the database guid is specified it will link to all versions of that specific database.

Example 6.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new dynamic record link group for the MI_Training database in 'MaterialUniverse' table (GUID = '0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000') with a specified guid, referential integrity model and forbid orphans flag. If the guid is not specified a random new Guid will be generated. If referential integrity model is not specified it defaults to 'One to One' model. Example 1.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new static record link group for the MI_Training database in 'MaterialUniverse' table (GUID = '0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000'). This will link from 'MaterialUniverse' table to itself.

Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated. This will link from 'MaterialUniverse' table to 'ProcessUniverse' table

Example 3.description: This example demonstrates how to create a new cross database record link group for the MI_Training database in 'MaterialUniverse' table (GUID = '0000dd92-0011-4fff-8fff-0000ffff0000'). Normally, if the guid is not specified, a random new Guid will be generated. This will link from 'MaterialUniverse' table to a table in different database. Since the database guid is specified it will link to all versions of that specific database.

post.summary: Returns search results by identifier

get.summary: Returns all searches visible to the calling user.

post.summary: Creates a new search with the specified properties.
Retrieves a collection of searches that match the specified criteria.

get.summary: Returns the given search if it exists and the calling user has access to it

put.summary:
If the search exists, updates the properties of the search. This will overwrite all current properties.
If the search does not exist or the calling user does not have access to it, returns '404 not found' response.

get.summary: Check whether the API is available
Returns status information for all databases
Returns status information for a given database
Returns disk status information for the search cluster

GrantaMIRecordPropertyFakeAttributeIdent.description: Values that can be used in place of an attribute identity to perform a search, aggregation or export of a record property. RecordCreatedBy and RecordModifiedBy cannot be used in free text search or aggregation.

useIntegratedSecurity.description: Set to true if the SQL connection to the new database should use Windows authentication

sqlUserName.description: The user name to use if the new database should use SQL authentication. The password must also be provided.

initialCatalog.description: The name of the database in SQL server

additionalSqlParameters.description: (Optional) Any additional parameters that will be added to the SQL connection string for the database. Must be a valid SQL connection string format.

isReadOnly.description: (Optional) True if the database should be set to read only after adding

loadingOrder.description: (Optional) The MI loading order for the database

language.description: (Optional) The language of the database, used when indexing the database. Currently "english" is the only supported value.

versionGuid.description: (Optional) Overrides the database version guid stored in the database. This must be unique across all the loaded databases.

GsaAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation.

This is one of: 
 * GsaAttributeAggregation
 * GsaFreeTextAggregation

GsaAggregationCriterion.description:
This is one of: 
 * GsaAttributeAggregationCriterion
 * GsaFreeTextAggregationCriterion

GsaAggregationDatum.description:
This is one of: 
 * GsaIntegerAggregation
 * GsaPointAggregation
 * GsaRangeAggregation
 * GsaIntegerHistogramAggregation
 * GsaPointHistogramAggregation
 * GsaRangeHistogramAggregation
 * GsaDateTimeAggregation
 * GsaDateTimeHistogramAggregation
 * GsaShortTextAggregation
 * GsaDiscreteTextAggregation
 * GsaLinkAggregation
 * GsaLogicalAggregation
 * GsaFloatFunctionalAggregation

GsaAggregationDatumCriterion.description:
This is one of: 
 * GsaDateTimeAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaDateTimeHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaDateTimeFixedWidthHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaDateTimeFixedCalendarWidthHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaDiscreteTextAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaIntegerAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaPointAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaRangeAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaIntegerHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaIntegerFixedWidthHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaPointHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaPointFixedWidthHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaRangeHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaRangeFixedWidthHistogramAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaShortTextAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaLinkAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaLogicalAggregationDatumCriterion
 * GsaFloatFunctionalAggregationDatumCriterion

GsaAggregationDatumCriterionType.description:
Possible values:

  • DateTime: Aggregation datum criterion date time type
  • DateTimeHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion date time histogram type
  • DateTimeFixedWidthHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion date time fixed width histogram type
  • DateTimeFixedCalendarWidthHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion date time fixed calendar width histogram type
  • DiscreteText: Aggregation datum criterion discrete type
  • Integer: Aggregation datum criterion integer type
  • IntegerHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion integer histogram type
  • IntegerFixedWidthHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion integer fixed width histogram type
  • Point: Aggregation datum criterion point type
  • PointHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion point histogram type
  • PointFixedWidthHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion point fixed width histogram type
  • Range: Aggregation datum criterion range type
  • RangeHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion range histogram type
  • RangeFixedWidthHistogram: Aggregation datum criterion range fixed width histogram type
  • ShortText: Aggregation datum criterion short text type
  • Link: Aggregation datum criterion link type
  • Logical: Aggregation datum criterion logical type
  • FloatFunctionalGraph: Aggregation datum criterion float functional graph type

GsaAggregationDatumType.description:
Possible values:

  • Integer: Aggregation datum integer type
  • Point: Aggregation datum point type
  • Range: Aggregation datum range type
  • IntegerHistogram: Aggregation datum integer histogram type
  • PointHistogram: Aggregation datum point histogram type
  • RangeHistogram: Aggregation datum range histogram type
  • DateTime: Aggregation datum date time type
  • DateTimeHistogram: Aggregation datum date time histogram type
  • ShortText: Aggregation datum short text type
  • DiscreteText: Aggregation datum discrete text type
  • Link: Aggregation datum link type
  • Logical: Aggregation datum logical type
  • FloatFunctionalGraph: Aggregation datum float functional graph type

GsaAggregationType.description:
Possible values:

  • Attribute: Aggregation attribute type
  • Text: Aggregation text type

aggregationCriteria.description: The aggregations you wish to perform.

GsaAggregationsRequest.description:
A request for aggregation information from a particular scope. The type of information
requested can vary: for example, for attributes, it could be a request for minimum/maximum
values, or for common text terms.
            
An aggregation request is associated with a particular scope (database, table, integration
schema, etc) based off the API invoked; however, the scope can be further narrowed down by
providing a criterion in the aggregation request. Only data from records matching that
criterion will be considered when aggregating data.
            
Note that only some types of criterion will be supported: in particular, criteria that involve
"matches" criteria against functional attributes, or link-attribute criteria against record
link groups, are not eligible to be used as an aggregation query criterion.

criterion: An optional query criterion, to be used to filter the collection of records to aggregate over.

GsaAllProfilesInfo.description:
Object containing list of all profiles as well as default profile if it is set and can be found within the list.

defaultProfile: Profile used by default in MI Applications. Null if no default profile is chosen or if default profile is not visible for current user.

GsaAllValuesSpecifier.description:
Specifies no filtering.

This extends: GsaValueSpecifier

The value of discriminator property ('filterOn') must be equal to 'all'

This extends: GsaDatum

The value of discriminator property ('notApplicable') must be equal to 'applicable'

isHiddenFromSearchCriteria.description:
If true, the attribute should not be shown in search UIs.
It will still be included in text searches.

GsaAttribute.description:
This is one of: 
 * GsaPointAttribute
 * GsaIntegerAttribute
 * GsaRangeAttribute
 * GsaLogicalAttribute
 * GsaShortTextAttribute
 * GsaLongTextAttribute
 * GsaDateTimeAttribute
 * GsaDiscreteAttribute

 * GsaFileAttribute
 * GsaPictureAttribute
 * GsaTabularAttribute
 * GsaFloatFunctionalAttribute
 * GsaDiscreteFunctionalAttribute
 * GsaMathsFunctionalAttribute

attributeIdentity.description: The identity of the attribute that was aggregated over.

attributeGuid.description: The GUID of the attribute that was aggregated over.

count.description:
The number of records that have a populated (applicable) value for this attribute.
(For multi-valued attributes: the number of records that have one or more populated
(applicable) values for this attribute.)
            
For a tabular attribute, this will be the number of records that have at least one
tabular row in this attribute, even if those rows might be filtered out from users'
views in some clients.

GsaAttributeAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation over an attribute. In all cases this will report the number of records in
the aggregation scope that have a value for the attribute. In some cases, depending on the attribute
type, we may be able to report more information. For example, aggregating over a numeric attribute will
also provide the minimum and maximum values that attribute takes across records in the aggregation
scope.

This extends: GsaAggregation

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'attribute'

This is one of: 
 * GsaAttributeValueAggregation
 * GsaAttributeExistsAggregation

GsaAttributeAggregationCriterion.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific attribute or meta-attribute. Exactly one of the identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaAggregationCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'attribute'

This is one of: 
 * GsaAttributeAggregationValueCriterion
 * GsaAttributeAggregationExistsCriterion

GsaAttributeAggregationExistsCriterion.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific attribute or meta-attribute.

This extends: GsaAttributeAggregationCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('attributeAggregationCriterionType') must be equal to 'exists'

GsaAttributeAggregationType.description:
Possible values:

  • Value: Attribute aggregation value type
  • Exists: Attribute aggregation exists type

GsaAttributeAggregationValueCriterion.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific attribute or meta-attribute,
including summary information about the values assumed by the attribute.
            
For a numeric attribute (integer, point, range, or date-time), the summary information will
be the minimum and maximum values assumed by the attribute on some record.
            
For a simple text attribute (discrete, short-text), the summary information will be the most
common terms in the search index for that attribute.
            
This can also be used within the inner criteria of a 'link' attribute aggregation, to request
an aggregation over a local tabular column.

This extends: GsaAttributeAggregationCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('attributeAggregationCriterionType') must be equal to 'value'

GsaAttributeCriterion.description:
Base class for attribute criterions. Exactly one of the attribute identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'attribute'

This is one of: 
 * GsaAttributeMatchesCriterion
 * GsaAttributeExistsCriterion
 * GsaAttributeNotApplicableCriterion

GsaAttributeExistsAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation over an attribute, reporting only the number of records with a value
for the attribute.

This extends: GsaAttributeAggregation

The value of discriminator property ('attributeAggregationType') must be equal to 'exists'

GsaAttributeExistsCriterion.description:
Criterion for matching record where there is data on the attribute specified. Exactly one of the attribute identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaAttributeCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('attributeCriterionType') must be equal to 'exists'

chartable.description: Determines whether or not this attribute is chartable in an X/Y bubble chart.

expressionable.description: Determines whether or not this attribute can be used in an expression.

linkable.description: Determines whether or not this attribute can be linked to from a tabular column.

The value of discriminator property ('attributeCriterionType') must be equal to 'notApplicable'

GsaAttributeSortCriterion.description:
Specifies an attribute based sort criterion for a search query. Either the GUID or identity of the sorting attribute must be provided.

sortType: For a text-type sort, whether the results should use a natural or a pure alphabetical sort. Defaults to natural.

This extends: GsaSortCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'attribute'

GsaAttributeType.description:
The types of attribute that are supported by the API.

Possible values:

  • Integer: Integer
  • Point: Point
  • Range: Range
  • Logical: Logical
  • ShortText: Short Text
  • LongText: Long Text
  • DateTime: Date and Time
  • Discrete: Discrete Value
  • Hyperlink: Hyperlink
  • File: File
  • Picture: Picture
  • Link: Link
  • FloatFunctional: Float functional
  • DiscreteFunctional: Discrete functional
  • MathsFunctional: Maths functional. Also known as Embedded Equations and Logic (EEL).
  • Tabular: Tabular data

GsaAttributeValueAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation over an attribute, reporting the number of records that have a value for
the attribute, plus additional aggregation information about the attribute values. The exact type of
additional information will depend on the type of attribute.

aggregationDatum: The type of datum associated with this attribute. (Note: a tabular attribute will be listed as type 'link'.)

The value of discriminator property ('attributeAggregationType') must be equal to 'value'

all.description: Only records that match all of these criteria are returned.

any.description: Only results that match any of these criteria are returned.

none.description: Only results that match none of these criteria are returned.

GsaDatabaseStatus.description:
Possible values:

  • Unknown: The current state is unknown.
  • Ok: The database is working correctly.
  • Unloaded: The database is not loaded.
  • Loading: The database is currently being loaded.
  • Unloading: The database is currently being unloaded.
  • FailedToLoad: The database failed to be loaded.
  • FailedToUnload: The database failed to be unloaded.
  • Disabled: The database is currently disabled.
  • SchemaUpgradeRequired: The database is at a lower version of the database schema than the current software
  • SchemaDowngradeRequired: The database is at a higher version of the database schema than the current software

databaseKey.description: Gets the database key for this database.

isLocked.description: Gets a value indicating whether the database is locked for non-admin users.

schemaVersion.description: Gets the schema version of the database.

searchIndexInSync.description: Whether the search indexes for this database are in sync with the database changes

GsaDateTimeAggregation.description:
This extends: GsaAggregationDatum

The value of discriminator property ('datumType') must be equal to 'dateTime'

GsaDateTimeAggregationDatumCriterion.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a datetime attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values, and a count of records with a value for the attribute.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTime'

This extends: GsaAttribute

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTime'

This extends: GsaApplicableDatum

The value of discriminator property ('datumType') must be equal to 'dateTime'

GsaDateTimeDatumCriterion.description:
dateTime: Criterion for matching records where the datetime data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.

This extends: GsaDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTime'

GsaDateTimeDatumExistsCriterion.description:
Inner criterion of an attribute exists search criterion for when the only bit of information about the datum that we want to convey is its type

This extends: GsaDatumExistsCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTime'

offset.description: Optional offset of the lowest bucket boundary, in SI time units. Must be an integer followed by one of the following units: ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days). Defaults to 0. Must be less than the interval. Negative offsets (e.g. "-6h") are supported

GsaDateTimeFixedCalendarWidthHistogramAg.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a date attribute. The returned aggregation will contain a histogram of the data with a fixed calendar interval.

interval: Fixed size of the resulting histogram buckets, in a calendar interval

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTimeFixedCalendarWidthHistogram'

interval.description: Fixed size of the resulting histogram buckets, in SI time units. Must be an integer followed by one of the following units: ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days)

offset.description: Optional offset of the lowest bucket boundary, in SI time units. Must be an integer followed by one of the following units: ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days). Defaults to 0. Must be less than the interval. Negative offsets (e.g. "-6h") are supported

GsaDateTimeFixedWidthHistogramAggregatio.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a date attribute. The returned aggregation will contain a histogram of the data with a fixed interval.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTimeFixedWidthHistogram'

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'dateTimeHistogram'

GsaDiscreteValuesCreateDiscreteValue.description:
Create dto for Discrete Values
No extra properties compared to CreateSlimNamedEntity yet, but exists for consistency with other 'create dto' types

GsaDiskStatus.description:
The status of the amount of space remaining on the disk.

Possible values:

  • Ok: There is enough space.
  • LowWatermarkReached: Once the disk reaches this point, Elasticsearch will not allocate any more shards to this node.
  • HighWatermarkReached: At this point, Elasticsearch will attempt to relocate shards away from this node.
  • FloodStageReached: At this point, Elastic search will enforce a read only block on the index.

isFlexLicensingEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether FlexLM licensing is enabled. If true, MI is in Ansys
licensing mode. If false, MI is in classic licensing mode.

miServerEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether MI Server is enabled. In Ansys licensing mode, this corresponds
to an MI Server license having been checked out. In classic licensing mode, it is set to true.

workflowAdvancedEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether advanced workflow features are enabled. In Ansys
licensing mode, this corresponds to a Workflow Advanced license having been checked out. In classic licensing mode, it
is set to true.

restrictedSubstancesBAEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether features associated with the Restricted Substances Analytics
product are enabled. In Ansys licensing mode, this corresponds to a Restricted Substances Analytics license (granta_mi_rsba) having been checked
out. In classic licensing mode, it is set to false.

sustainabilityEnabledEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether features associated with the Sustainability Analytics
product are enabled. In Ansys licensing mode, this corresponds to a Sustainability Analytics license (granta_mi_sus) having been checked
out. In classic licensing mode, it is set to false.

PLMSyncEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether features associated with the PLM Sync (notably MI Enterprise Connect) are enabled.
In Ansys licensing mode, this corresponds to a PLM sync license having been checked out. In classic licensing mode, it is set to true.

MLEnabled.description:
Gets a flag indicating whether features associated with the ML (Machine Learning) are enabled.
In Ansys licensing mode, this corresponds to a ML license having been checked out. In classic licensing mode, it is set to false.

expiryDate.description: Gets expiry date of Server license.

GsaEnabledLicensesInfo.description: Stores information about the state of the MI Server license.

GsaExcludeValuesSpecifier.description:
Filters based on a list of identities or guids to exclude.
All other guids or identities will be included.
Only one of identities or guids should be specified.

This extends: GsaValueSpecifier

The value of discriminator property ('filterOn') must be equal to 'exclude'

An attribute as defined in an integration schema.

Similar to IntegrationSchema, but without identities.
Used when we don't want consumers to specify/know about identities.

Any mapped parameters (float functional attributes only). The target parameters must be defined on the target integration attribute.
Not every parameters from the source database needs to be mapped for each attribute.

GsaHyperlinkTarget.description:
A target for a `HyperlinkDatum`

Possible values:

  • NewWindow: Target a new window (equivalent to "_blank").
  • Top: Target the topmost frame of the current frameset (equivalent to "_top").
  • Parent: Target the parent frame of the current frame (equivalent to "_parent").
  • Tree: Target the left-hand side frame.
  • Content: Target the right-hand side frame.
  • CurrentFrame: Target the current frame (equivalent to "_self").

error.description: This is the error message from the indexing exception. It may have been returned directly from Elasticsearch.

recordWasOversized.description:
Records that contain a large amount of data are intentionally not sent to the index. This size limit is configurable through
MIServer.exe.config

GsaIndexRecordFailure.description:
Detail of a record that has failed to successfully index. A record that was not indexed will not be returned
as a result in any searches.

isUnique.description: Whether or not the attribute is constrained to contain a unique value

This extends: GsaApplicableDatum

integer: Criterion for matching records where the integer data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.

interval.description: Fixed size of the resulting histogram buckets

offset.description: Offset of the lowest bucket boundary. Defaults to 0. Must be less than the interval.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'integerHistogram'

unitSymbol.description: If isUnitted is true, then this must have a non empty value

discreteTypeGuid.description: A discrete attribute must define the guid of its discrete type (i.e. list of possible values)

parameters.description: A float functional attribute must define a list of parameters.

graphType.description: A float functional attribute must be either a Series or a Grid type graph.

xAxisParameter.description: A float functional attribute must define an x-axis. This will be one of the parameters listed in parameters

GsaIntegrationAttribute.description:
An attribute as defined in an integration schema.

targetDatabase: A link attribute must define the database of the linked records.

targetTable: A link attribute must define the table of the linked records.

recordReferences.description: A list of records to export. These are references to the underlying records in the source database

attributeIdentities.description: A list of attribute to export. These are the attribute identities from the integration schema.

GsaIntegrationDiscreteType.description: An integration schema discrete type defines the list of values that a discrete attribute can take.

GsaIntegrationLayout.description: An integration schema layout is named list of attribute identities.

GsaIntegrationSchemaOfObjectIdentifier.description:
A type representing an integration schema. An integration schema is a schema that describes
a shape that data must conform to, similar to an MI schema, but unlike an MI schema, an
integration schema does not have any corresponding data stored in it. Instead, an integration
schema defines mappings or transformations from existing stored data, which may be a different
shape from the integration schema.

loadedDatabases.description: Loaded databases have been successfully indexed into the integration schema.

loadingDatabases.description: Databases which are in the process of loading.

notLoadedDatabases.description:
Databases that are referenced in the schema but that are not yet loaded. This could be because they are still queued for
load in the MI system, or because they have not yet been added.

erroredDatabases.description: Databases that encountered an error while loading. These databases will not be available for searches.

loadedDatabaseIndexStatuses.description: Index information about all loaded databases, including the out of sync status.

searchIndexUpToDate.description:
Whether all changes up to and including the most recent database revision have been sent to the search index. This will return true
even if some of those revisions could not be indexed

searchIndexOutOfDateDuration.description:
How long has the index been out of date.
Specifically the duration between the first non-indexed revision and the current time.

searchIndexInSync.description: Returns false if the search index is out of sync with the database (i.e. because changes were made that could not be indexed)

searchIndexIsReadOnly.description: True if the index is read only.

searchIndexUnavailable.description: True if the index could not be contacted.

recordsThatFailedToIndex.description: Details of any records that failed to index.

GsaInvalidParentStateErrorDetail.description:

The value of discriminator property ('reason') must be equal to 'invalidParentState'

GsaInvalidVersionStateErrorDetail.description:
This extends: GsaVersionControlErrorDetail

GsaJobStatus.description:
Possible values:

  • Pending: Pending
  • Running: Running
  • Succeeded: Succeeded
  • Failed: Failed
  • Cancelled: Cancelled

applicableApplications.description: If there are no ApplicableApplications, the layout is applicable in all applications.

GsaLayoutItemType.description: The types of layout item that are supported by the API.

targetDatabase.description: May be null for a cross database link group that can target multiple databases

targetDatabaseVersion.description: May be null for a cross database link group that can target multiple databases

forwards.description: true if the link points from the table the layout is in; or false if it points towards the table the layout is in (an inbound link).

GsaLinkAggregation.description:
This extends: GsaAggregationDatum

The value of discriminator property ('datumType') must be equal to 'link'

GsaLinkAggregationDatumCriterion.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a tabular attribute. The local columns specified will be individually aggregated
across all rows (including rows without linked records, which may be hidden in clients).
            
The returned aggregation will contain a list of the individual column aggregations that have been performed. Within these
column aggregations, the 'record count' instead denotes the number of relevant tabular rows across all records in the
aggregation scope, rather than the number of records. This row count will include rows that may be hidden from the user's
view in certain clients.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'link'

localData.description: The local columns to export. Reuse the attribute object here - but the 'attribute id' is now the column id.

targetDatabaseGuid.description:
Database containing the linked records. For reverse cross database links, this is the database where the link is defined.
This is not required for cross-database link groups that don't have a target database.

targetAttributeGuid.description:
For tabular searching: this is the identifier of the short-text linking attribute.
Otherwise null.

recordProperties.description: The properties to export on any linked records.

attributes.description: The attributes to export on any linked records.

GsaLinkAttributeToExport.description:
Export request information for a 'link' attribute.

This extends: GsaAttributeToExport

The value of discriminator property ('attributeType') must be equal to 'link'

targetTableIdentity.description:
Table containing the linked records.
The target table can be omitted; it is likely to improve performance if it is included.
For tabular search, if either the target attribute or the target table is provided, they should both be provided.

targetTableGuid.description:
Table containing the linked records.
The target table can be omitted; it is likely to improve performance if it is included.
For tabular search, if either the target attribute or the target table is provided, they should both be provided.

targetDatabaseKey.description: Database containing the linked records. For reverse cross database links, this is the database where the link is defined

targetAttributeIdentity.description:
For tabular searching: this is the identity of the short-text linking attribute.
The target attribute and table can both be omitted; it is likely to improve performance if they are included.
If either the target attribute or the target table is provided, they should both be provided.
Otherwise null.

targetAttributeGuid.description:
For tabular searching: this is the GUID of the short-text linking attribute.
/// The target attribute and table can both be omitted; it is likely to improve performance if they are included.
If either the target attribute or the target table is provided, they should both be provided.
Otherwise null.

GsaLinkDatumCriterion.description:
link: Criterion for matching records that are linked to records that match the inner criterion. The target database and table specify the location of the linked records.
The inner criterion must be a criterion that applies to the records in the linked table. The link group followed will be the link group specified on the outer AttributeCriterion.
A target database is required unless searching local tabular data - In that case, the inner criterion must be absent, and the local criterion will be used.

localCriterion: Criterion to filter local properties of the link. For a tabular attribute search, this will be a criterion against the local columns and so it will use column ids/guids instead of attribute ones. For other types of link, this is currently unused.

indirectLinks: For static and cross database links: whether the search should consider indirect links between records. The default is to decide based on the definition of the links

innerCriterion: Criterion to run to filter the linked records. When running linked search for tabular attribute we are searching against actual records and attributes, so attribute ids/guids should be used instead of column ids/guids.

localRowsBehavior: For tabular searching: Additional row filtering behavior for a search against local columns, or a tabular data exists search.

This extends: GsaDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'link'

targetDatabaseKey.description: Database containing the linked records. For reverse cross database links, this is the database where the link is defined

targetAttributeIdentity.description:
For tabular searching: this is the identity of the short-text linking attribute.
Otherwise null.

targetAttributeGuid.description:
For tabular searching: this is the GUID of the short-text linking attribute.
Otherwise null.

GsaLinkExistsDatumCriterion.description:
link: Criterion for matching records that are linked to records by the given link group. The target database and table specify the location of the linked records.

indirectLinks: For static and cross database links: whether the search should consider indirect links between records. The default is to decide based on the definition of the links

localRowsBehavior: For tabular searching: Additional row filtering behavior for a search against local columns

This extends: GsaDatumExistsCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'link'

GsaLinkExportFailure.description:
This extends: GsaExportFailure

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'link'

GsaLinkSourceType.description:
Source links for an integration schema can either be static (within an single database), or cross database. Cross database links must indicate which database they are defined in - a reverse cross database link is defined in the "target" database of the mapped integration schema attribute.

Possible values:

  • RecordLink: A static record link that links records within a single database.
  • CrossDatabaseLink: Links records across multiple databases.
  • ReverseCrossDatabaseLink: Links records across multiple databases, and is defined in the "target" database of the mapped integration schema attribute. Links records in that database to the source database defined in the mapping.

GsaLinkedAttributeTabularColumn.description:
This extends: GsaTabularColumn

The value of discriminator property ('columnType') must be equal to 'linkedAttribute'

GsaLinkedColumnTabularColumn.description:
This extends: GsaTabularColumn

The value of discriminator property ('columnType') must be equal to 'linkedColumn'

GsaLinkedRecordExportBehavior.description:
Optional property to allow filtering of the linked records returned in an export. If used on a tabular export, can be used to filter both the linked records and the tabular rows.
If a summary roll up is included, the summary row for the tabular datum will include a rollup of the linked records.

GsaLinkedRecordTabularColumn.description:
This extends: GsaTabularColumn

The value of discriminator property ('columnType') must be equal to 'linkedRecord'

GsaLinkingValueMatchBehavior.description:
Enum for use in the Granta.Server.Api.Search.TabularLinkingValueCriterion to control which tabular rows are returned

Possible values:

  • AllRows: Return any row where the local data matches
  • VisibleRows: Return rows with matching linking values, or no linking value
  • ExactMatchMatchingRows: Return rows with matching linking values
  • FreeTextMatchingRows: Return rows with linking values that match when using the usual free text search analyzers

GsaListBooleanCriterion.description:
listBoolean: Criterion that wraps other criteria in order to specify how the results should be joined together. Used in searches for record lists.

This extends: GsaListCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'listBoolean'

GsaListCriterion.description:
The criterion to be used in a search for record lists.
            
Multiple criterion can be provided. These should be wrapped with a boolean criterion that specifies whether the search should return results that match "any" or "all" of the criteria.
These criteria can be nested to created complex search queries.

This is one of: 
 * GsaListBooleanCriterion
 * GsaRecordListSearchCriterion

databaseGuid.description: The database GUID of the record

recordHistoryGuid.description: The record history GUID of the record

recordVersion.description: Optional record version. If not specified, search will return lists that were added with unspecified version

GsaListItemRecordReference.description: Object that uniquely identifies a record

startIndex.description: The index of the first list in the collection to be returned. If not provided it will start at index 0.

pageSize.description: The number of lists to be returned per page. If not provided the number of returned lists will be unlimited.

localColumnIdentity.description: The identity of the local column that was aggregated over.

localColumnGuid.description: The GUID of the local column that was aggregated over.

count.description: The number of records that have a populated (applicable) value for this local column.

GsaLocalColumnAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation over a tabular local column. In all cases this will report the number of rows in
the aggregation scope that have a value for the local column. In some cases, depending on the datum
type, we may be able to report more information. For example, aggregating over a numeric datum will
also provide the minimum and maximum values that local column takes across records in the aggregation
scope.

This is one of: 
 * GsaLocalColumnValueAggregation
 * GsaLocalColumnExistsAggregation

GsaLocalColumnAggregationCriterion.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific tabular local column. Exactly one of the identity or GUID must be provided.

This is one of: 
 * GsaLocalColumnAggregationValueCriterion
 * GsaLocalColumnAggregationExistsCriterion

GsaLocalColumnAggregationExistsCriterion.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific tabular local column.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnAggregationCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnAggregationCriterionType') must be equal to 'exists'

GsaLocalColumnAggregationValueCriterion.description:
A criterion for requesting aggregations for a single specific tabular local column,
including summary information about the values assumed by the local column.
            
For a numeric local column (integer, point, range, or date-time), the summary information will
be the minimum and maximum values assumed by the local column.
            
For a simple text local column (discrete, short-text), the summary information will be the most
common terms in the search index for that local column.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnAggregationCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnAggregationCriterionType') must be equal to 'value'

GsaLocalColumnCriterion.description:
Base class for local column criterions. Exactly one of the local column identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'localColumn'

This is one of: 
 * GsaLocalColumnMatchesCriterion
 * GsaLocalColumnExistsCriterion
 * GsaLocalColumnNotApplicableCriterion

GsaLocalColumnExistsAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation over a tabular local column, reporting only the number of rows with a value
for the local column.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnAggregation

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnAggregationType') must be equal to 'exists'

GsaLocalColumnExistsCriterion.description:
Criterion for matching record where there is data on the tabular local column specified. Exactly one of the local column identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnCriterionType') must be equal to 'exists'

GsaLocalColumnMatchesCriterion.description:
Criterion for a search matching values in a given tabular local column. Exactly one of the local column identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnCriterionType') must be equal to 'matches'

GsaLocalColumnNotApplicableCriterion.description:
Criterion for matching record where there is not applicable data on the local column specified. Exactly one of the local column identity or GUID must be provided.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnCriterionType') must be equal to 'notApplicable'

GsaLocalColumnValueAggregation.description:
The results of aggregation over a tabular local column, reporting the number of rows that have a value for
the local column, plus additional aggregation information about the local column values. The exact type of
additional information will depend on the type of local column.

This extends: GsaLocalColumnAggregation

The value of discriminator property ('localColumnAggregationType') must be equal to 'value'

GsaLocalRowsBehavior.description:
Enum for use in a tabular search, to optionally further filter the results based on whether the matching rows are linked. The default value of AllRows will return all rows matching the local search.

Possible values:

  • AllRows: Return any row where the local data matches
  • VisibleRows: Return rows with matching linking values, or no linking value
  • ExactMatchMatchingRows: Return rows with matching linking values
  • NoLinkingValueRows: Return rows with no linking value

guid.description:
The GUID of this object. The GUID represents the object on a semantic level, and two objects of
the same type with the same GUID are considered to represent "the same concept". GUIDs should be
robust against data changes and database upgrades, and should be preferred where possible.

name.description:
The name of this object. The name represents the object at a human-readable level, but two objects of
the same type with the same need not represent "the same concept". Because the name is less uniquely identifying,
clients should prefer GUIDs where possible, and operations based on name instead of GUID may fail if the name
cannot be uniquely resolved. Certain object types may consider names to be equivalent

identity.description:
The underlying identity of this object. This represents the object at a data level, and two objects
of the same type with the same identity are considered to represent "the same object". However, identities
are not robust against database upgrades, and are only reliable and consistent within a currently-
loaded database in a running MI instance. Clients should prefer GUIDs where possible, and operations
based on identity which persist data will be resolved to GUIDs instead (and may fail if this cannot
be done).

GsaObjectIdentifier.description:
Properties that identify an object within the MI system.
            
An Granta.Server.Api.ObjectIdentifier created by MI will always contain values for all three
properties. An Granta.Server.Api.ObjectIdentifier created by a client need not contain values for
all three properties, and is allowed to contain values or combinations of values that do
not correspond to an existing object in MI (in which case the Granta.Server.Api.ObjectIdentifier
will be resolved against MI objects first by GUID, and then by name, and finally by identity,
taking the first match and ignoring subsequent fields.

pageSize.description: The number of results that should be returned in each page

keepAliveInMinutes.description: The length of time that the paginated search should be kept in memory

pageNumber.description: (Optional) the (1-indexed) number of the page to return from the search. No pages are returned if not provided

GsaPagingOptions.description: An optional field for paging options. If provided on a request, the response will contain an identifier that can be used to retrieve the other pages. Page size must be smaller than 10,000

This extends: GsaAggregationDatum

The value of discriminator property ('datumType') must be equal to 'point'

Criterion for aggregating data within a point attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values (in database units), and a count of records with at least one value for the attribute.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'point'

This extends: GsaApplicableDatum

The value of discriminator property ('datumType') must be equal to 'point'

GsaPointDatumCriterion.description:
Criterion for matching records where the point data is within the given bounds. If one of gte or lte is null, this will be an open ended search.
If this is a unitted attribute, the search values should be given in terms of the units defined for the attribute in the database/integration schema.

This extends: GsaDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'point'

interval.description: Fixed size of the resulting histogram buckets

offset.description: Offset of the lowest bucket boundary. Defaults to 0. Must be less than the interval.

GsaPointFixedWidthHistogramAggregationDa.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a point attribute. The returned aggregation will contain a histogram of the data with a fixed interval.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'pointFixedWidthHistogram'

This extends: GsaAggregationDatum

GsaPointHistogramAggregationDatumCriteri.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a point attribute. The returned aggregation will contain a histogram of the data with a fixed number of buckets. The buckets may have variable widths.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'pointHistogram'

key.description: Key is a unique identifier of a profile. Separate from guid.

guid.description: Guid is a unique identifier of a profile. Separate from key.

GsaProfile.description: A profile, consisting of a set of tables from one or more databases.

If set, only include attributes of any of these types.
Note that Tabular attributes have type: link.

name.description: If set, attribute name must match any of these names.

GsaQueryAttributeFilter.description:
Optionally filter results.
            
If multiple properties are set, then attributes must match all of them.

GsaQueryAttributeInfoProperties.description: Set values to true to include those properties in the query response

isFunctionalRange.description:
For a Granta.Server.Api.AttributeType.FloatFunctional attribute, whether the value for this attribute is ranged.
For other attribute types, returns null

GsaRangeAggregationDatumCriterion.description:
Criterion for aggregating data within a range attribute. The returned aggregation will contain the minimum and maximum
values (in database units), and a count of records with a value for the attribute.
            
As in MI elsewhere, a range with only one boundary specified is treated like a point, rather than an infinitely large range.

This extends: GsaAggregationDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'range'

If this is a unitted attribute, the search values should be given in terms of the units defined for the attribute in the database/integration schema.

This extends: GsaDatumCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'range'

offset.description: Offset of the lowest bucket boundary. Defaults to 0. Must be less than the interval.

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'recordListMember'

isOwner.description: Flag indicating if the user or group is an owner of this list.

isSubscribed.description: Flag indicating if the user or group is subscribed to this list.

isCurator.description: Flag indicating if the user or group is a curator of this list.

isAdministrator.description: Flag indicating if the user or group is an administrator of this list.

isPublisher.description: Flag indicating if this user or group is a publisher of this list.

isRevision.description: Restrict to record lists that are (non discarded) revisions.

containsRecordsInDatabases.description: Limits results to lists containing records in any of of the specified databases

containsRecordsInIntegrationSchemas.description: Limits results to lists containing records in any of the specified integration schemas

containsRecordsInTables.description: Limits results to lists containing records in any of the specified tables

containsRecords.description: Limits results to lists containing any of the given records

userCanAddOrRemoveItems.description: Limits results to lists where the current user can add or remove items.

GsaRecordListSearchCriterion.description:
recordList: Search criterion for a set of record lists.
            
The properties in the this class represent an AND search - only lists that match all of the non-null properties will be returned

This extends: GsaListCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'recordList'

GsaRecordProperty.description:
A record property represents data on a record that typically cannot be independently edited,
as opposed to attribute data which may be edited on a record freely (albeit possibly requiring
releasing a new version). Record properties are usually tracked by the system automatically
and are usually read-only.
Note: for legacy reasons, some 'record properties' do not fall into these criteria, and do
represent editable record fields more similar to attribute data. These record properties are
usually exposed in this API as both 'record properties' and 'pseudo-attributes'.

GsaRecordPropertyCriterion.description:
Criterion for a search matching values in a given record property.

This extends: GsaCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'recordProperty'

GsaRecordPropertyInheritanceType.description: An API-level enum for the possible options for inheriting properties when copying or moving a record history.

GsaRecordPropertySortCriterion.description:
Specifies a record property based sort criterion for a search query.

sortType: For a text-type sort, whether the results should use a natural or a pure alphabetical sort. Defaults to natural.

This extends: GsaSortCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'recordProperty'

GsaRecordReference.description: The unique way to identify a record history (which may have multiple versions) in an MI system

GsaRecordReferenceCriterion.description:
Criterion that returns records matching a specific reference. The database key must be provided, along with either the record GUID or the record identity.

This extends: GsaCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'reference'

GsaRecordSubsetCriterion.description:
Criterion that returns records matching a specific subset. The database key must be provided, along with either the subset GUID or the subset identity.

This extends: GsaCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'subset'

GsaRecordType.description: An API-level enum for the supported record types.

This extends: GsaProperty

The value of discriminator property ('propertyName') must be equal to 'recordType'

GsaReleasedDateProperty.description:
This extends: GsaProperty

The value of discriminator property ('propertyName') must be equal to 'releasedDate'

Specifies a relevance based sort criterion for a search query

This extends: GsaSortCriterion

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'relevance'

GsaReplacementString.description: A piece of text that can be inserted into a data value so that multiple data can be changed in one place.

GsaRichTextType.description:
The types of datum that are supported by the API.

Possible values:

  • Plain: Represents plain text.
  • Markdown: (no description available)

GsaRollupExportFailure.description:
This extends: GsaExportFailure

The value of discriminator property ('type') must be equal to 'rollup'

diskStatus.description: The status of the disk compared to the Elasticsearch space thresholds.

diskThreshold.description: The 'flood stage' disk usage threshold from Elasticsearch. Elasticsearch enforces a read-only block on indexes once this is exceeded.

diskThresholdMaxHeadroom.description: The maximum headroom of the Elasticsearch 'flood stage'. If set, nodes with at least this amount of space will not be set as read-only even if they exceed the disk threshold

clusterUnavailable.description: True if the cluster could not be contacted.

searchIndexUpToDate.description:
Whether all changes up to and including the most recent database revision have been sent to the search index. This will return true
even if some of those revisions could not be indexed

searchIndexOutOfDateDuration.description:
How long has the index been out of date.
Specifically the duration between the first non-indexed revision and the current time.

searchIndexInSync.description: Returns false if the search index is out of sync with the database (i.e. because changes were made that could not be indexed)

searchIndexIsReadOnly.description: True if the index is read only.

searchIndexUnavailable.description: True if the index could not be contacted.

recordsThatFailedToIndex.description: Details of any records that failed to index.

GsaSearchMaskUsageDataModificationErrorD.description:
This extends: GsaUsageDataModificationErrorDetail

The value of discriminator property ('referencedByType') must be equal to 'searchMask'

sortCriteria.description: An optional set of attribute based sort criteria. If none are provided, the results will be sorted in descending relevance order.

GsaSearchRequest.description:
criterion: The main search criterion.

pagingOptions: An optional field for paging options. If provided, the response will contain an identifier that can be used to retrieve the other pages.

searchIdentifier.description: If the search request had paging options specified, this will return an identifier that can be used to get the rest of the results

pageNumber.description:
The (1-indexed) number of the page to return from a search
The size of the page was determined by the original query

GsaSearchableRecordProperty.description:
Properties of a record that can be used to in searches

Possible values:

  • CreatedDate: The date a record was created.
  • Creator: The username of the person who created the record.
  • LastModifiedDate: The date a record was last modified.
  • LastModifier: The username of the person who last modified the record.
  • RecordType: Whether we return records, generics or folders (or a mixture).
  • Color: The color of the record.
  • VersionState: The version state of the records that will be returned. Only Released, Unreleased or Unversioned are supported.
  • VersionNumber: The version number of the record.
  • RecordName: The full name of the record.
  • TreeName: The name of the record as it is displayed in the tree.
  • DatabaseKey: The database key of the record.
  • TableName: The name of the table that the record is in.
  • TableIdentity: The identity of the table that the record is in.

The value of discriminator property ('referencedByType') must be equal to 'securityAttribute'

readGroup.description: Members of this groups can read data from the integration schema.

adminGroup.description: Members of this group can perform administrative tasks such as adding or deleting the schema.

GsaSecurityGroups.description: The security groups that apply to an integration schema. If null or empty, the default MI security groups will be used.

It will still be included in text searches.

GsaTabularColumn.description:
Possible values for RollUpType depends on the underlying data type of the column:
            
- FloatFunctional: Chart, Count
            
- Numeric types (Integer, Point, Range): Count, CountDistinct, List, ListDistinct, Max, Min, Mean, StdDev, Sum, CoefficientOfVariation
            
- Other types: Count, CountDistinct, List, ListDistinct
  - DateTime, Logical, and ordered Discrete also include Min and Max.

This is one of: 
 * GsaLinkedAttributeTabularColumn
 * GsaLinkedColumnTabularColumn
 * GsaLinkedRecordTabularColumn
 * GsaLocalPointTabularColumn
 * GsaLocalRangeTabularColumn
 * GsaLocalIntegerTabularColumn
 * GsaLocalLogicalTabularColumn

Unit system contains mappings from any unit to equivalent unit within this unit system.
If some unit comes from particular unit system it will be mapped to itself.

It will still be included in text searches.

author.description: The author of the database. Can only be edited by a database data administrator

company.description: The company on the database. Can only be edited by a database data administrator

notes.description: The notes for the database. Can only be edited by a database data administrator

currencyCode.description: The currency code on the database. Can only be edited by a database data administrator

versionGuid.description: The version guid of the database. Can be edited by a database data administrator or a system administrator

guid.description: The unique identifier of the database. Can only be edited by a system administrator

name.description: The name of the database. Can only be edited by a database data administrator

isReadOnly.description: True if the database should be set to read only. Can only be edited by a system administrator

language.description: The language of the database, used when indexing the database. Can only be edited by a system administrator

databaseKey.description: The unique key of the database. Can only be edited by a system administrator

dataSource.description: The SQL server data source. Can only be edited by a system administrator

useIntegratedSecurity.description: Set to true if the SQL connection to the database should use Windows authentication. Can only be edited by a system administrator

sqlUserName.description: The user name to use if the database should use SQL authentication. The password must also be provided. Can only be edited by a system administrator

sqlPassword.description: The password name to use if the database should use SQL authentication. Can only be edited by a system administrator

initialCatalog.description: The name of the database in SQL server. Can only be edited by a system administrator

additionalSqlParameters.description: Any additional parameters that will be added to the SQL connection string for the database. Must be a valid SQL connection string format. Can only be edited by a system administrator

loadingOrder.description: The MI loading order for the database. Can only be edited by a system administrator

GsaUpdateDateTimeAttribute.description:

GsaUpdateTabularColumn.description:
Possible values for RollUpType depends on the underlying data type of the column:
            
- FloatFunctional: Chart, Count
            
- Numeric types (Integer, Point, Range): Count, CountDistinct, List, ListDistinct, Max, Min, Mean, StdDev, Sum, CoefficientOfVariation
            
- Other types: Count, CountDistinct, List, ListDistinct
  - DateTime, Logical, and ordered Discrete also include Min and Max.

This is one of: 
 * GsaUpdateLinkedAttributeTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLinkedColumnTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLinkedRecordTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalPointTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalRangeTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalIntegerTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalLogicalTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalShortTextTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalLongTextTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalDateTimeTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalDiscreteTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalHyperlinkTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalFileTabularColumn
 * GsaUpdateLocalPictureTabularColumn
